author: etharkh
content: Thanks. The real world scenario would be to get estimate on when the next withdrawal of a validator would happen. Having to fetch the full beacon state only for this info, would be too much of data waste. I will open an issue there

author: jgm
content:
You don't need the full state, the current block and validators state is enough.

If you want this information as a one-off you can use something like this:

```
ethdo validator withdrawal --validator=12345
Withdrawal expected at 2024-11-13T04:25:23 in block 10387325
```

If you are running this repeatedly then you could fetch the data periodically to keep it relatively fresh.  Bear in mind that it's only ever going to be an estimate until very close to the actual withdrawal block (because blocks can be not proposed or orphaned, which pushes all subsequent withdrawals further out).
